intro: Verbascum pseudothapsiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf mullein, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of soft, woolly hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers in late summer, which are clustered in elongated racemes. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Verbascum pseudothapsiforme is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects on respiratory ailments.
